So, we should have different rooms for different pages.
Or Channels for that matter.
We can have different “channels” (which are like rooms) for different work streams. If many pages come under the same work stream, they can all go into the same channel.
Let's say we are working on the _page of the week_, then we can dedicate a channel for all its related discussion.
Yep.

Can everyone please add other members of the Metakgp team whose email ids you know, to this slack?
ok So, I wanted to discuss how to decide what page should be a metakgp wiki and where we should link to an external website?
I think there should be a fixed criteria to decide this.

I think the criteria is roughly: If something is important by itself, it should be on the wiki, either as a page, or as  a section on a page, depending on how much information there is. External links should only be used as references.
"important" needs to be objective
I think we should not have wikis of profs
But, then
we should have too considering we might want to put information on how good/bad tehy are and courses they take
eventually
Things like this and should we have a TSG wiki
or we can just link teh TSG page

I think the bar for important is: is any editor willing to take the trouble to create a page for that topic. An external link is the easiest thing to do, second easiest is a section on an existing page, and highest effort is a new page.
If there’s a lot of information to put about a prof, especially from across multiple sources, I would definitely want to write a wiki page about him/her.
What about TSG?
TSG should definitely have its own wiki page.
hmm.
There’s a lot of stuff to write about TSG.

Random thought: what do you think about asking instiinfo guys to join us?
If they have the same intention as us then makes sense, but to me I smell that they plan to add ads on the website and earn over time.
Seems to me. I might be wrong.
Also, they are an information website. I don't think they care about the history. I prefer wiki because of that majorly.
I also think they plan to put ads on the website later, after we are more comprehensive they are redundant, but we should at least talk to them and see if they are interested in joining us.
Somehow, way more people know about instiinfo than metakgp.
They started out earlier and they were heavy on PR
we'll get popular too
I think they are just trying to develop their web development or design skills. And create something useful out of it.
Also it seems they are more inclined towards providing information than generating revenue. But of course we can always ask.
<@U0AHQ8HD3>: They put posters and notices in LBS, the largest resident hall on campus :stuck_out_tongue:
Hmm. If they actually care about providing information, we might gain a few valuable contributors. Also, they seem to have done quite a bit of legwork, going to DepC students and such.
Clearly their website has a very different philosophy, but they may just not have thought of this one, or thought it would be viable.
